About


I’m a postdoctoral research fellow of the Volkswagen Foundation at Universität Heidelberg’s Center for American Studies.

I earned my PhD in English from Washington University in St. Louis, specializing in 19C U.S. literature. I’m finishing a first book on abolitionist writers’ reclamation of Puritanism and starting a second on the Melville Revival.

Both projects involve large archives, so I sometimes use digital tools to find broader patterns for literary and historical analysis. As a DH fellow at Wash U, I helped faculty do similar work on 19C German and U.S. novels (topic modeling, translation comparison, etc). I’m also building a digital edition of William Lloyd Garrison’s The Liberator.

I’ve taught at WUSTL and Deep Springs, where I learned to lasso. I write criticism and essays in my free time, or ride my Bullet. Testtest.
